entity.name: react-navigation
entity.description: Routing and navigation for your React Native apps

comments: Seems the best of a bad bunch. Has a fair amount of issues.

don't want to use React navigation because it feels janky and slow even with its native stack Navigator. Though that's the best choice we have available today and I hope we find better and faster navigation solutions.
Well-built. Has most stuff in mind (deep link management, wrapping Native navigation APIs, Type safety for routes and params)
androdi’s performance issue’s are still exist, especially on 4+ hours sessions
would love better support for global modals/toasts/overlays

Only begrudgingly, because every time I come back to React Native, the API changes for the better and it makes all my legacy code completely worthless, and the documentation often misses common configurations or cases I have to hack around until months later I discover there was a way to do that the whole time but it's only mentioned in a blog post.
Still missing the render as you fetch pattern unfortunately

Not good as navigation react native. feels of mixing native and react. not feel a native exp. as a developer. api too complicated and forces to think one way and use it. bad on web and too buggy. not good at github issue handling. when I facing an error, first I will look solution like searching on github issues, googles and source codes etc. and when I can't find any related issue, I find myself to forces to find another hacky way instead of opening issues. one issue I opened a years ago and it turns out auto closed one. no one's answer my issue nor labelling it. sadly, I find react-navigation one-man's repo.

"Would use again" but with a few caveats that declaring routes as JSX components is a massive overhead that provides almost no upside besides a familiar API.
Nested navigation is hard to set up and can be confusing in large scale apps.
I'd be nice to have native tabs support with react-native-screens though!
I don't like it at all, but it seems to be the best of a bad bunch
